title: Improve SP Documentation (VISION & ARCHITECTURE)
description: Complete all TODOs identified in VISION.md and ARCHITECTURE.md to improve documentation clarity, standards compliance, and examples. Requirements: Follow documentation-standards.md throughout, add concrete use case examples, define SP specification more clearly, improve architecture documentation.

title: Follow Documentation Standards in VISION.md & ARCHITECTURE.md
description: Review claude/documentation-standards.md and apply standard formatting, structure, and style to both VISION.md and ARCHITECTURE.md. Ensure consistent terminology and structure throughout both documents.

title: Add Use Case Examples to VISION.md
description: Add concrete examples of use cases that need the messaging substrate. Show how SP solves problems that existing solutions don't address well. Include examples of different coordination patterns in real agent systems. Examples should be realistic and relatable to agent coordination.

title: Define SP Specification More Clearly
description: Clearly define what SP is: pure Go implementation of Scalability Protocols spec. Document which protocols SP implements (REQ/REP, PUB/SUB, PIPELINE, SURVEY, BUS, PAIR). Add SP history/context (evolution from Scalability Protocols spec). Clarify wire-protocol compatibility model.

title: Enhance ARCHITECTURE.md Documentation
description: Ensure architecture document follows documentation standards. Review and improve clarity of component descriptions. Verify all design decisions are well-explained. Check that diagrams and text align. Validate that all sections are complete and easy to understand.

title: Create Product Requirements Documents (PRDs)
description: Design and propose Product Requirements Documents for key SP subsystems and features. Each PRD should clearly define requirements, design decisions, and acceptance criteria to guide implementation and testing.

title: PRD: Transport Abstraction Layer Design
description: Design the transport abstraction layer that supports both Unix domain sockets and raw IP sockets. Document the interface that transport implementations must satisfy. Define test suite for transport compatibility. Specify performance requirements and benchmarks. Address: How does the abstraction hide transport-specific details? What is the interface for dial/listen/send/recv? How are message boundaries preserved? How do backpressure and flow control work?

title: PRD: Protocol Engine and State Machine Design
description: Design the protocol engine that implements Scalability Protocol patterns. Document each pattern's state machine (REQ/REP, PUB/SUB, PIPELINE, SURVEY, BUS, PAIR). Define how protocol engines interact with I/O workers. Specify message routing and handoff mechanisms. Address: Goroutine topology? How are message IDs tracked? What is the subscription model? How does load balancing work in PIPELINE?

title: PRD: I/O Worker and Syscall Handling Design
description: Design the I/O worker layer that handles all syscalls. Document recv and send worker responsibilities and coordination. Specify error handling for transport-level failures. Define message framing and buffering strategy. Address: Buffering in send worker? Message framing from stream transports? Timeouts and error handling? Worker coordination with protocol engine? Backpressure model?

title: PRD: Socket API and Blocking Interface Design
description: Design the public Socket API that applications use. Document the synchronous Send/Recv blocking interface. Specify socket lifecycle (Open, Close, Listen, Dial, Connect). Define error handling and timeout semantics. Address: Blocking semantics of Send? (write-ready, sent, confirmed?) What happens when Recv has no messages? Peer address handling for datagram patterns? Context/cancellation model?

title: PRD: Testing Strategy and Quality Assurance
description: Define comprehensive testing strategy for SP. Specify unit tests, integration tests, and benchmark tests. Document wire-protocol compatibility testing. Define performance benchmarks and targets. Address: How to test each protocol pattern? Edge case scenarios? Wire-protocol compatibility verification? Performance baselines and targets? Goroutine cleanup and leak tests?

title: PRD: Go-Native Async API Design (Phase 2)
description: Design the async API that leverages Go channels and contexts. Document how channels integrate with protocol patterns. Specify cancellation and timeout handling with contexts. Define the relationship between sync and async APIs. Address: How do channels map to protocol patterns? Buffering strategy for receive channels? Context cancellation propagation? Can applications mix sync and async calls on same socket? Migration path?
